bug.author: vin101

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vin101>@vin101</denchmark-link> Could you attach the words.txt file please?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/files/355118/input.txt>input.txt</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/files/355119/words.txt>words.txt</denchmark-link>

@Goldado  Here is the input file and the word.txt, sorry for the delay

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vin101>@vin101</denchmark-link> There doesn't seem to be a problem with the net's output. I came just this afternoon across an error when I first opened UiServer on Chrome, I had the "no data ... please upload it as txt or retry later" smthn of that sort (seems to be the one you had). I just kept reopening localhost:8080 and clicking TSNE, and it worked about the third time. Give that a try.

@Goldado Thanks it worked! Well it works sometimes. Refreshing multiple time solved it, but it is nondeterministic. It works sometimes and sometimes you are stuck with the following error: No t-SNE data available! Please upload something, or check again later.Ã—

That sounds pretty strange, and pretty wrong. As far as i see, this thing is more then determenistic: once T-SNE caclulations are finished - coordinates are posted to UiServer, and that's the end of the process :) Once it's available on server - all subsequent requests for those coords are served from there. So, question is: are you able to use network monitor built into Chrome? Maybe that's just some caching issue?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/raver119>@raver119</denchmark-link> Yes once the graph is visualized, consecutive attempts are successful. The problem is loading the graph in the first place. Sometimes it loads with 5-6 browser refreshes and sometimes it doesn't and I have to re-run the entire process. I have tried using Safari to isolate the issue, but the same problem persists.
T-SNE is special case, it shows result only after calculations are finished, so it's not a real-time Listener.

It has been working fro more than 12 hours for a data set which is not normal I guess. The output still shows INFO [2016-10-03 15:08:33,003] org.deeplearning4j.plot.BarnesHutTsne: Error at iteration 4 is -2982997.5690521626 as its last line. Any idea? Thanks.
That depends on amount of input data, data dimensionality, number of iterations, etc. So no, this doesn't sound like something impossible.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
